This game reminds me a bit of a very simplified version of Starsector, crossed with FTL: Faster Than Light. Despite it's simple nature, there is a bit of depth to this game. You command a small fleet and venture around the galaxy, fighting enemies and upgrading your ships along the way. You will die a lot, but don't let that discourage you. The best part of this game is lack of annoying in game ads and microtransactions.
Game is a bit classic in its appearance, but nicely set and entertaining. Tactical and strategically thinking is helpful and applying that makes the game enjoyable.

Fun game could use more flavor text filled events to give it a real personality and allow for a bit more player agency, a crew recruitment and allocation/leveling system would also have been a welcome feature. These thing alone could have taken what is here to a five star game. Otherwise fully satisfied.
Always enjoyable, replayable. Small bugs on android, S7+ tablet, no issues on iPad

Unfortunately plays backwards: it's awful at the start but more fun the longer you play it! This game starts off like running into a brick wall: often you get blown up in the first minute of a new campaign (even on Easy mode) but if you have the patience to slowly "grind out" enough failed campaigns you will eventually unlock the better ships which eventually make the game actually fun to play (especially once you can get the "carrier ships" that allow two+ fighter escorts each).

This game is what I've been looking for ever since space rpg3. It's a niche game. No ptw. Difficult. This is not another flashy gimmick and I really appreciate that. Solid mechanics. Nerve racking encounters and battles in real time. Random missions and galaxy, death game. Highly customizable ships and formations/fleets. Love it.

A real stand-out in the app store. Well-balanced combination of turn-based and real-time strategy. Sort of a cross between FTL and a 4x game like Sins of a Solar Empire. Start with a single capital ship. Travel a randomized network of systems, completing quests and building a small fleet. Find and purchase a wide variety of weapons, strike craft, and fun space toys like teleporters and tractor beams. So good I bought the devs' early access PC game, Space Haven, which is right up my alley.

I installed the game and it won't show up as an app, but in the play store it's installed. I have to go to the play store, so it's definitely not an offline game. It's sort of a hassle to get to it. Please fix this.

Edit: i first hated this game once i discovered (the hard way) that it has permadeath. Even so, i've spent no less than 25 or 30 hours playing this silly little game, with no end in sight. It has excellent controls (though the addition of a "repair all ships" button would not go amiss), lovely audio, a casually-paced RTS combat system (with the ability to pause and assign commands), can be put down and picked up on a moment's notice (it saves constantly, so there's no way around making a poor decision or dying an untimely death), and has both a 4-part campaign and an "endless" mode, where the 4 levels repeat until the player is eliminated. Unlock new ships via leveling up and collecting tokens which drop from alien ships now and then. (Tip: the campaign cannot be won on the first try - it requires using upgraded ships). Despite all the time i've spent on it, there are still 5 or 6 ships left to unlock. The only truly annoying bit now is the slow rate at which resources are gained, taking ages to afford a second/third ship or replace a lost one. PS: play it on a tablet, not on a phone.
Love it, keep playing it

replyContent: Hey, Zack! Thank you for the feedback. Increasing fleet size is not something we wanted to do, since we wanted every ship to matter and have more of an emotional investment to it. More ships means every ship becomes less important. Hope this explains our view =) Sector Siege is towards the other direction, with lots of units.

The game is great, but there are a few exploits from what I've seen: 1. Gatling fighters with max damage easily melt enemies with no shields (their guns are much stronger than point defense gatling). 2. You can put units on top of each other, creating a temporary "super unit" with multiple shields (you can even do this with battlestations). What the game does poorly are the small lasers especially on drones (they can barely intercept missiles when perpendicular), and splash damage (on nukes).

Playing it between devices (PC & Android phone) is a blast with my thanks to their syncing system but also, that system requires to upload and download saved files manually after every run especially before you want to switch devices. The gameplay is simple and addicting but on a limited time and attention. However, it's still fun with the urge to unlock the next ship. Controls? Tablet/smart phone controls are way better than on PC/Laptop. But keep it up devs! It's a recommendation for me.

Edit: nice try devs. i started the game dozens of times. i tried out every one of the turrets available with the starting credits. offensive turrets, shield emmitters, fighters, and even purchasing the wingman vessels in different variants for extra fighters or just shooty escorts. the first few enemies still wipe the floor with the player ship or ships, usually in seconds. the one time i managed to win the first fight, the reward in resources made what is generally called "a pittance" look like riches. i've been looking for years for a spaceship game where i start with a ship, upgrade it, enhance it, fly around, and then work towards a bigger better ship to fly. i thought this might be it, but i was wrong and my search continues...
replyContent: Hi! There's credits to spend on a turret or two in the beginning. This will usually carry well over the first fights. Remember that you can also jump out of a fight that seems to be a futile one. Simply wait for the hyperdrive to charge and jump out. Being close to a Battlestation will give you a good place to jump to, and draw them into a trap.

not clear which weapons are better than others because they cannot be 
compared. (also for eg. what does burst upgrade do?). A weapons table or 
linear hierarchy would help. One last thing, how can I save game? It 
appears that if you exit the game, it is saved but if you loose in map 3/4 
for example you have to start all over again! I can't imagine what will 
happen on more difficult levels. Game should be saved after each map 
completion, please fix that!
Fun game.

Best paid game i have ever played so far, please let us the player design 
our own ship and please make a lot of content for this game

Really cool concept, but there are a few major problems. This game is 
extremely greedy with XP; it basically takes a massive grind fest in order 
to gain access to new ships, even though it is a paid game. Also, there is 
no save mechanism and sometimes your entire fleet will be destroyed before 
you can even blink, forcing you to start back from square one. You can play 
for 2 hours, get destroyed, and then find out you only gained 1/4th of the 
needed XP for the next level. This just gets old real fast.
This game is amazing! Very addicting, for this price is a steal
Awesome game!

A high quality game. Once you understand the quirks and unlock level 4 
ships you'll be able to progress further through the game without losing 
your ship.
Love it
Great phone strategy
Play a lot, great game

It's great. Really. Totally worth the purchase. Other games have come and 
gone but this has stood the test of time. It just plays really well and I 
recommend it.
I enjoy the simplicity yet depth of this sci-fi fleet building game.

Love this game. I have had it quite some time now and it always gets new 
ships and great updates. Putting this game on hard really makes you step up 
your game. Always play on hard now and have beaten it maybe 5 times, great 
replayability. Always looking for that mega plasma cannon or long range 
death ray. Great job guys, best game on Android IMO and fairly cheap.

Why 3 Stars? Look, it's a good game. I wanted to play it for a while before 
I commented. Here are the 3 reasons why. #1: This game is incredibly 
difficult. Even harder than some very seasoned Space RTS Computer Games 
I've played that are famous for being hard. I get that Bugbyte wants to 
keep the game playable and not something you play/beat do everything in one 
weekend and delete. Even on easy though, I bet I died 20 times on the first 
day, due to lack of metal/upgrade points on map, or whole fleets jumping on 
top of me with just my 1 ship. #2: If you are going to make us fight 
through hell to level up and unlock better ships, at least make them worth 
it please. After Assault ship, Armor, Shields and Speed seem to actually 
decrease on almost every ship. With the only thing that seems to increase 
is module and weapon mounts. Seriously, the higher up the ship, the more 
expensive and powerful it should become, not weaker. #3 The pay of for 
missions is very poor considering the effort for them. Especially the item 
retreival, you have to clear multiple sectors to get the items and then you 
just gain the ship as a wing man (Which barely has any armor or Shields) or 
a horrible pay off from stations. That all being said, I like this game, 
this is not a rant, just constructive criticism. I really enjoy the music a 
lot, props to the composer, gives me a Nostalgic Saturday Morning Cartoons 
feel.
replyContent: Hi! Thank you for the feedback. When you get a bit further along in the levels the unlocked ships will start to be significantly more powerful in every way. Those first unlocks are a bit bad, this is true. Thanks!

content: Best game in the app store, by far.

Greatly recommended. For those who complain and been defeated because of 
"ambush" and such, stop crying and get good. For those who complain that it 
needs tutorials, "how-to-play", etc., Learn how to play. It's simple enough 
to play even for a 4th grader.
Awesome

Too simple with little variety in tactics but an OK game to kill some time. 
Certainly better than other Pay2Gamble2Win rubbish on android.
Great fun

Need more ships and weapons...and also cuztomize your own ship like 
building your own

Played this game quite a while, and quite enjoyed it. After many attempts 
and many failures, I had finally built up a "fleet" that was doing well, 
and I had my tactics going well. I finally made it to the forth level. 
Then, the game stuck me in an unwinnable situation and ambushed me there. 
For as much time and effort as it took to get that far, only to find out 
that it's just another "screw the human" game that you ultimately can't win 
without just blind luck, I have now deleted this (purchased) game...and I 
won't be back. Don't waste your money on it, unless you are a masochist.
replyContent: Sorry you felt that way. It's the game random generator generating enemies trying to keep the difficulty level rising at a optimal rate throughout the game. Since it is random the game plays will vary on situations that come up. It has good and bad sides to it for sure. But otherwise there are no walls or other things put in place to stop winning.

content:
Needs documentation or some kind of introduction walk-through. The is 
little or no explanation what many of the commands do, where things are 
stored, how buying and selling works, etc.

Game is great. I would love to see more storyline, longer gameplay, more missions maybe. I like different builds that are possible, but there are some meta-builds. Still half through, but I feel that buying smaller or faster ships is pointless (on any point or stage of the game). Firepower is most effective. All that doesn't mean the game is not great and making your own "best" setup is super fun. It's that good you want more. And that's my only complain. I'll buy dlc for it.

Great game! Need an update or new version. Once you complete everything, you can only do so much. Yeah there is an endless mode but once your fleet is maxed, seems like there is no point to keep trying to reach the extremely high scores. Still love the game though
I've been waiting for this game ever since Masters of Orion. Absolutely perfect design and you own it!!! None of this in app purchase cheap. I'm a huge fan instantly.
replyContent: Awesome! Be sure to check out our upcoming game here: http://bugbyte.fi/spacehaven/

content: Awsome
Nailed it!
The only game that has been on all of my phones.
Graphics are a little cheesy but it fun so far. :)

Great game, progression is slow but the gameplay is fun and interesting. Only blight is that I signed on yesterday to find I'd lost everything and I'd need to grind to unlock it all again... Shame but I won't be playing to unlock stuff I had access to until yesterday.

content: Absolutely entertaining game!  At first when you find out that there is no save game it feels quite frustrating but then you realise that after every lost game you get new opportunities it gets more and more interesting! And the most important - you don't have to pay for anything beyond the initial payment.
Great space strategy game.  Always challenging, hardest levels are impossible building up point to use on bonuses.
Need more depth! But great game!
It's a great little game that is easy to pick up and waste some time on. It's even better that you get it all with no additional purchase. You can't go wrong with this one if you like space games.
Booring, regret buying
Great game. Was dubious at first and thought it would get boring fast. However, I am glad that I persisted and really fell into the adventure. Can be slightly addictive.
If you like turn-based strategy space games, this one is pretty decent. Good job guys.

Yes they have some questionable game mechanics (leveling up) but the game is great. One of those games where you want more. It's tough and takes lots of figuring out but I don't mind dying for some reason. Usually I hate it. Must mean I really like the game. Edit: The devs actually fixed a bug that was driving me nuts. 6/5 stars.
Its boring I want my money back

Absolutely my fav time consumer game of all time. Perfectly balanced in every way. Challenging but never overly frustrating. It seems repetitive yet I cannot stop trying to beat the game on hard. The game continues to give new and different options to give me reasons to keep coming back

I freaking LOVE this game and have easily spent more time playing this than every other mobile game I've played combined. Edit: Dev replied that they are aware of it! 5 stars for the most deserving game ever! Can't wait for Space Haven!
replyContent: Yes, we are aware of it. We have patched the game so hopefully it will be fixed. We will update the game here in coming days.

content: 1 year later: Amazing; I still play this game. In terms of hours played, by far the best mobile game I've ever played. Devs: I know you're working on a new game now anyway, but a sequel to Harbinger would be great :)
replyContent: Hi, Matt! Wow, that is great to hear. We really did succeed well with this one. We will definitely keep a sequel in mind, hope you are subscribed to our community! If you aren't you can do it here: http://bugbyte.fi/spacehaven/ (Home page for Space Haven)

content: Fantastic! Great game for your inner admiral
It's a great game but you need more weapons and ships to make it more fun you can also add more upgrades and a little more easier to earn experience
Very fun

content: Tactical space game. Save the human race. Great controls. Easy learning curve  Love it
Fun game, kills time, makes you want to beat it and challenges you

This is a really fun game plz make more like this but more different like at all the race or do multiplayer mode on this so so we can build and survive as a team and at one game with friends and make a whole  fleet

Solid gameplay. Easy to learn. Everything is nicely scaled to difficulty levels. Weapon and ship variety is impressive. High stakes lead to high scores.

Very solid space combat game for the mobile. Has some progression elements, multiple units, a cool upgrade system, and is generally well worth the money. Tutorial could be improved, but beyond that very solid.
Runs fantastically, no microtransactions, beautiful graphics and nice balance between defenses and weapons. This is a must buy!
replyContent: Hi! Try turning sounds off in main menu, so no weapon sounds on. That should make it smooth to play! This is a specific problem, we are working on fixing it.

content: Hey longtime fan here, great game all around but there's a bug with the defend missions where the enemy ships fly off the edge of the map where I can't get to them. This is very frustrating because it causes me to lose the mission and the station. Fantastic game keep up the good work
Good

Endless fun- repetitive but addictive-  as long as new ships keep coming i will keep playin

I like it. It took a while to understand the UI and mechanics, but a few hours in and I'm hooked. This is a cross between FTL and gratuitous space battles. The gameplay is somewhat passive: it's all about how you kit out your fleet and less about micromanaging battles.  A few annoying problems: sometimes it drops you straight on top of an enemy which may as well be game over if you've got a long ranged Loadout. Also enemies can move outside the battlefield meaning you can't target them anymore.
this game is really fun, but, its just a bit too hard.

I didn't understand the appeal but after some thought and actually sitting down I like it. The ship customization is pretty neat and it scratches that I'm captain Kirk itch. Worth the price of admission for sure.
Great strategy game
The game is so unbalance you can't progress for more than 15 to 20 minutes at a time before being destroyed and having to start over.
Its ok

I like its simplistic nature, but was expecting a little more of a story / free exploration. Rather than just, go here, pick this item up... take it there.  The perma death ads some pressure and tension but it can be very frustrating when your Faster Than Light drive gets jammed and you get ambushed and there is nowhere to go.   Some of the ships dont have the capability to self repair (with an item you buy or find) so it is even more frustrating when you get damaged and there is no where to repair for a while.   There are also some bugs in this game like when you pick a certain mission but there is also a 'escort ship' mission it will pick that regardless. As mentioned it is pretty simplistic so you dont have to be as quick to make commands as you would in most RTS games, but i think this may be more suitable for turnbased battles as it does feel a bit like you are just a bystander and there isnt really any quick dodging or anything like that.  At first I really enjoyed it, but it can be too frustrating to start from scratch again when your hard work is blown to smitherines.  The graphics are good and it seems to run at a decent rate when ive not got the most amazing smart phone.
Awesome game, still having difficulty trying to unlock all the ships though.
Not a bad game, gets repetitive in the end. Somehow the BGM is always messed up and sounds like static everytime i started/loaded a game
An actual game, not another quarter-hearted dollar jerker that 90% of the app market believes we need. Harbinger is challenging, yet very rewarding. A recommended buy.

It's a great game but be ready cause you're gonna die every time until you realize that you need to basically hide and pick off the little ships and run when the bigger ships arrive unless your next to an allied base

Im sorry i paid for a gmae which i enjoyed to start now every time i defend a station my game is over - i have 8 enemy ships attacking and they have all flown off the map i can pursue or attack. Shame i spent my money

The game has been fun for a while but lately, missile boats have been showing up on defense missions and leaving the screen so that they can't be targeted. They never come back and if you quit and restart it just spawns more. Your only option is to leave and fail the mission.

replyContent: Hi! When the emp pulse comes you need to go to the star map and select the sector you are currently in. There should now be a "wait" button there where the jump button usually is. Press that and then you have waited a turn and you should be able to continue :)

content: An amazing RPG but I'm just curious how come you can't recruit a Harbinger or Crucible or such other ship I understand that be expensive but if you're playing on an endless mode it be really nice to have 2 super powerful top-tier ships to recruit or such other I think just opening those ships up to recruiting would make the game just a little bit more fun and exciting  I love your game and it would be nice to be able to have 3 top-tier ships to go out and see if I can break my record

Would also like to see some new weapons added as well, it feels like there is not a very large variety, maybe there could be a crafting system, drag two guns together and pay some scrap and make a new gun. Just a idea.  Now about controls, I gave this three stars and that's only because selecting my ships can be a bit hard some times would like to see some buttons added that will allow me to select one of my ships. I think this would be better then having to zoom in tap a ship and then tell it where to go every single time... Overall a great game. üëç

Devs at Bugbite all I can say is that you have done a great job with this game. Thank you. The game is challenging as progression advances, as it should. Gameplay without challenge is dull and boring. I am looking foreward to the new release of the next addition to the Battlevoid series (Sector Seige), I am confidant that it will bring a new element of strategy and gameplay to an excellent and developing game series. Once again, thank to all involved for your hard work and dedication to releasing a quality experience. Your efforts are appreciated and respected. Be well dev team and keep up the good work.
replyContent: Thank you very much! We will continue developing games and try to do our best to make great ones every time.

content: Enjoyable game that is really only let down by a couple of things. Nothing that ruins the experience as a whole but things you'd expect from a game in 2017. Firstly the graphics. They are decent enough but ships seem a bit low res. Could do with some crispy ship textures. Secondly the lack of help. There are a number of on screen controls that are simply not explained anywhere. A bit of extra effort and this could easily be 5 stars.

A bit like real time space battles from master of Orion 2, without the planet management. Space battles are well enough done to be fun watch. Can punch you in the face if you are not paying attention, which is kinda good and what you want in a game. Looking forward to buying the sequel which should expand some of the more limiting parts of infinite game play. Great replay ability!
Very nice game, controls are little clumsy in real time battles.
A well made game for the tech we have on hand held devices!!

There are some balance errors. Devs should ad something like hull upgrades cause playing endless game eventually ends by your ship being destroyed with a single heavy plasma ball salvo from 4 bases of the unknown. Also jumping does not provide any tactical advantage when all weapons grow out to shoot in 2500 and longer distances.
Great strategy space combat game. Light on story, let's you get right into the thick of it after a less than 10 minute tutorial.   I wish there were better controls for the speeding up of battles.

I love this game and have spent hundreds of hours on it.  Controls are great on phone, and combat/strategy system is wonderful.  Also you get the full game for a more than reasonable price.  Devs keep updating the game too with new ships and features.
Non linear roguelike with huuuuge replay value.

Worth the buck fifty but didn't have staying power.

If you're not lucky, you'll have to fight something twice your size and twice your firepower. No, thanks. I really wish Gplay had the same refund policy as Steam has...
replyContent: Sorry to hear the game did not fit your taste. You can send a mail to support@bugbyte.fi and we can try to refund if the order is not too old.

Anyway, the game is great, but would be nice to see improvements for HARD diff :)

content: Im glad to see the full content update out on mobile. I loved this game from day one, that being said the new ships and second half of the extended content feels like it just gives me more options of playing the same game i have been playing. The first content update really took the game from a basic beta to a complete gamming experience. These guys have worked hard to bring us a game i feel they made because its what they wanted to play... not because they wanted to take money from you on a daily basis. Fantastic work from BugByte. Its been a long journey but hopefully not the end of this great game.
Ive found myself playing it for hours. And I don't usually play mobile games.
Very fun game to quickly scratch the space combat itch.
Offline, customised ships, combat. Upgrading components, max 3 ships (excluding fighters!). I just keep coming back to this.
If you love space games and blowing up your enemies, then play this. I thoroughly enjoy it.

Recommemded: A simple, clean, effective, and enjoyable rogue-like capital ship space combat sim.  Like many other space combat sims, Harbinger lets you select layouts and customise fitouts, but none gets you customising (and subsequently performing ship-on-ship battle) as QUICKLY AND EASILY as Harbinger.  Being a paid game, there is no freemium element artificially slowing down gameplay. It is a nice change of pace and effectively turns it into a punchy ROGUE-LIKE.  And most importantly, the devs and support team seem PASSIONATE AND RESPONSIVE, so I would recommend supporting their efforts amongst all those other corporately-cloned freemium rubbish games.

That being said, this is a mobile game and not a full retail priced game. I've gotten more hours out of this title than some consol games. Totally recommend and will be watching these devs future games.  Also tip for players, once you play through on easy and want to skip all the in between ships from lvl 5 to lvl 15. Otherwise an excellent game, lots of fun and a surprising amount of depth if you're trying for the highest score.

This game is exactly what I had been looking for. It is a perfect for mobile game for real gamers. There is plenty of depth, a ton to unlock, no crazy micro transactions, and most importantly you can pick it up and put it down at will. I'm really enjoying this game. The controls are easy to use, though the game uses iconography without tooltips or a primer for a majority of the games actions. This is frustrating at first but you quickly learn what everything means. The process took me maybe 15 minutes of gameplay.  I would recommend a page or two in the tutorial area that explains these more obtuse actions. Tapping on an enemy capital ship brings up a slew of options that I had no clue about. I had the same problem with the weapons. Many weapon abilities are self explanatory, but some aren't, and they aren't explained anywhere in-game I can find. Again, a revised tutorial would help greatly in this area I think.  Otherwise excellent title. It isn't too deep but still offers enough decisions per minute to keep you engaged. Well done devs, keep it up!

Great game but having trouble saving it. Every time I get killed I have to start all over again. Is it even possible to save? if so it is not intuitive at all. Hope it gets solved as i love this game
replyContent:
Hi! The game saves automatically every turn, but if you die it is game over and you have to start over. So you can quit the game and come back to where you left off if you don't die, but if you die then it starts over.

It's a roguelike element we wanted to have, you do get experience and unlock new ships so it's not all in vain :)

Greetings!

Hmm... We can understand your frustration but we feel it is not true that we did not deliver. We made the Kickstarter and delivered everything we promised in the Extended Edition. After the KS we had to move on or face eventual bankruptcy. It is not easy to make enough money to survive as an indie. We are here, we are doing our best :)

content: If you liked FTL or space rogulikes get this right now! Update: The December update is amazing! Bar none best mobile game I've ever had!

Hours and hours of time will be well spent playing this game.

You start off with the tutorial you find out you can move and stuff. Then you need to gear up your ship, upgrade said gear, roam different zones off of the intergalactic map. You pick jobs from friendly outposts. Then your one ship might not be too strong so you get more ships!! Not like ftl since you dont need to manage ressources. This is great game, i had some visual glitches but everything ran fine phone never crashed.

content: It is entertaining and challenging all at once creating this perfect mix of awesome! Thoroughly recommend this game to all!

First off, this game is awesome. Haven't found a mobile game this addictive and fun for a while. You can upgrade your ships to use different weapons and such to counter certain enemies and recruit other ships to join your party - which really makes this game even more interesting. The only thing I don't particularly like is the lack of variety in ships and weapons, there is an ample amount to start with, but you soon realise the weapon drops are the same weapon with varying stats. Buy it anyway!
Perfect everything
Best strategy game imaginable.   I wouldn't try playing it on a phone,  but amazing on a tablet.   Should be considered for editor's choice.

content: Worth the price I paid. I do wish it would autosave after major game accomplishments. ATM, when you die, you have to begin all over again no matter how far you've gotten. It can be a little frustrating if you make one small miscalculation only to die and have to start from the beginning with all your hard work, accomplishments and time gone. Ouch! If I'm wrong, and there is a way to save the game, please let me know what it is and make it easier to find.
replyContent: Hi! The game has a bit of roguelike elements so permadeath is one of them yes, no save in that way. There is level progression and unlocking new ships even if you die so hopefully that alleviates it a bit! Thanks for playing!

content: Love it

This game is quite appealing at the beginning, with lots of tinkering to build the most powerful ship. However, after finishing the campaign once, things get boring. It's always more or less the same. Also difficulty is not evenly spread. When you have the right gear, most battles are way too easy, except the one that is gonna get you killed.
Nice, but incredibly hard.
Not a bad all round game

This game is actually a lot of fun! Very challenging too. I've had it for about a week though and it's lost all my game data twice. High scores and all my unlocked ships. Super annoying. Would be a five otherwise. Saving to the cloud is an option, but really shouldn't be necessary. Running it on an LG E980. Help? EDIT: The saving issue seems to have gone away so this is definitely an excellent game. Fun, challenging, surprisingly deep, and oh yeah, epic space battles. Can't go wrong.
replyContent:
EDIT: Make sure to use the cloud save just in case! Or contact us at support@bugbyte.fi if it happens again.

Hi! Sorry about your troubles. Don't really know why it is losing your progress. Have you ran out of battery mid play? It should still work but it could be something to watch out for if that is the cause.

content: This game is fun. The only downfall is the difficulty when first starting and trying to get the blueprints. You really have to grind.

I've been looking for a good android game forever. Finally something that has infinite replay ability, and is actually challenging. Highly recommend. The only game that is equivalent is pixel dungeon for android. But I feel a lot of FTL influence as well with a very unique spin. For $1 it's a steal.
Love it
I ENJOYED FTL THIS IS ONE STEP BEYOND THAT

Small form, tactical RTS with turn based elements. Good visuals, decent interface, a rogue lite design, and a collection of text fluff for lore combine to make this a better than average mobile game.

Super Great and loving it!!! But... Well there arent enough Human ships around, Well there are those stations with there fighters, and those mercineries who shoot the bad aliens, and whats up with ther only being one enemy alien faction in a galaxy (Dont tell me there is the   occasional Trap where SOMETIMES Enemy ships come) and no other alien friendlies? content: Buy quickly...you wont regret it.

This is one of the best strategy space games out there. I've spent days finding a game worth paying for and this game is exactly what I wanted. Music, sound, interface and gameplay is amazing and the developers are active. *Thanks to the other helpful reviews
I love this game as I did Battlestation before it.
It's definitely challenging and a lot of fun.
Very addicting. Good game to sink some time.
Master of orion revisited, or something like that. I really enjoy this game.

The game play is amazing, challenging and intricate. I love this game. It needs more chapters a four set series of levels just leaves me craving more story line. Second I wish the were more 5 weapon destroyers to choose from. Third a item that lets you add an upgrade slot for example an increased range augment for weapons that don't offer that upgrade. Fourth a reflection shield for energy weapons. Fifth and most important to me the ability to see the component slots before I go in game with a ship.
It's great

An excellent game with high replay value. My only criticism is that I'd like to have more variety in the weaponry and ship upgrades, maybe have them as unlockables. Aside from that: excellent graphics, solid gameplay, and a good roster of ships to play.

I rated this game before. I have nothing but love for it. It can be a little hard particularly in the beginning. But it makes you think and play smart. The way the game is designed allows you to play for a short time or pause to answer a question. It auto pauses on phone calls or sleep. A great on the go game.

A little better on pc though because you can queue up move commands for easy flanking and trying to shoot engines. Have seen some bugs. Most notably with sound on one device (very bad) and cloud save on another (annoying)
Great game!
A true, fun, and frustrating experience! Well worth a buck for certain.

Would like to see a huge universe where u can actually build an empire of sorts with space stations that are customizable and all the races fight on the same map for conquest add research for researching upgrades such as ships engines or shields etc most importantly need larger variety of weapons even if there upgraded versions of existing weapons such as "projectile cannon Mark II" need more fighters and bombers would Like to see a gatling fighter and maybe a photon bomber mostly a bigger world is needed
New and diverse ships is a food idea.Plus more diverse weapons and maybe some unique weapons. They would give me quite a goal to achieve

Lose a handful of times on hard, unlock ships with 5 red bays, then keep losing again until you get a celestial start, keep taking out the ships as they spawn, attracting to a friendly base while you are weak and using it as a shield.  Get 2 more ships, load them out with the gradually-increasing-max-range ion cannons that will start dropping (sell the ones without burst or with shield dmg upgraded), buy 3-5 nukes and upgrade range, hull and speed, and seek out death rays or mega plasma drops / for sale.
Game worth every penny it would be great if they have added some more ahips and weaponry. But that is a minor thing.

content: Fun fun fun

Love it.. Found it by accident on the play store and it's the most fun I've had on a mobile game in a long while. Deffo recommend.

content: Awesome game, I have played it for a while now and its still fresh. The game is challenging and expects you to learn from your mistakes. The blueprints for new ships gives you a new reason to play.
Do not care for how long you must invest vs. how quickly you can lose it all.

Real time space ship to space ship combat, turn based galaxy map, loads of hull designs, guns and equipment to choose from. I've been thoroughly enjoying this game. The rogue-like death mechanic makes death useful.
Could use some more help text and/or tutorial. Hard to know, for example why shields are sometimes ignored.
Great game, careful with your battery dieing though. When my tablet shut down I lost everything but achievements. Pretty frustrating at high level. Other then that enjoy the hell outta it.

Wish there were some way to improve the chance of getting salvage, such as targeting certain areas of an enemy vessel, or spending more time on precision fire at the cost of taking more damage in return. Also wish we could upgrade our vessels to improve their abilities and increase equipment/cargo slots. Finally, the ability to capture enemy vessels and add them to your side would be neat.
One of the best rts games I found on Android.  And it is the best space game I found too (out there is good too)
I was thought this game is booring... thats why i refund it.. then a friend says that this game was fun and stuff the i bought it again... and play it... then i think its quite fun...

Get it now while it's only a dollar!  Do you like space themed games?  Do you like RTS?  Do you like turn based strategy?  Do you like dungeon crawlers?  This game mashes all of these elements into a finely crafted game.  Highly addictive and I would definitely pay for an expansion.

While there are a lot of annoying repetitive games on google play, this game brings a fresh approach and a lot of quality gametime. It s only fault is that after getting that last ship it sort of loses it s replayability. Great game. Keep up the good work.

I would love to see an update where i'll be able to add more ships to my fleet, maybe change it so you have to buy ship spaces, to a maxium of 4, maybe 5. With each space increasing cost by 5 or 10 Upgrade points. Also, the leveling up seems to go really slow, but it might be programmed like this.
Addicting
Really good game

Annoyed by the lack of a save feature, as it discourages exploration and experimentation. Also it really should warn you that installation will destroy the progress you have made, since usually you can install and reinstall games with no such loud of progress.  Also it seems silly that the quickest way to advance is to just start Hard-level games and die immediately. Some tweaking needs to be done to balance the game. Finally, it would be nice if advancing did something more interesting, maybe unlock weapon
Thank you for making a real game.
Great game, great custimer support!
How do I save my game? I exit and reload and cloud save bit every time I have to start from scratch
replyContent:
Hi! The game saves automatically your current game locally. So when you come back and just click play again it should continue from where you left off. Cloud save saves only your level progress, not your current game, but your unlocked ships so you can continue with same ships on other device.

You can contact support@bugbyte.fi for more help!

content: This game is fun, and different from the others in a very good way. I thing some of the things are overpriced, but that's just me probably. Good game, a few issues, but overall fantastic.

Read somewhere to play at the hard level and just accept you will loose at least 50 times really quickly but you will earn enough experience to get a good enough ship to actually play properly.   Still get frusrated when you get stuck in a location and cant leave with no hope of winning and loose everything you have slowly built up.  But I do appreciate much more of the really great stuff you have done here.  So yes my first score was too low (just after being trashed again!).  Just wish there was a way of not losing everything because you just gone to a bad location and starting from scratch again. Thx and importantly I do think it was worth the money!
replyContent: Hi there! Sorry you feel that way. The game can be quite punishing but we kind of wanted that :) A game, where winning is extra sweet due to the challenge. Totally understand it can be frustrating though, we tried our best to give this game a great amount of replay value by using this mechanism. Thank you for the feedback!

I have put just as many hours in to this game as I would with an AAA console game,  such a fun in depth game that is easy to play and hard to master. Also note that they have constently updated this game and made it even better.
It is the perfect ge for space fans. It let's you customize you ship, level up and unlock new ships that are bigger better and all around awesome. Obliterate your enemies.
While most android games are full of microtransactions and ads this is a full stand alone game. I wouldn't recommend it for phones since some of the ship's are very small. But a great tablet game.

This is my favourite game on Android, period.   Given the amount of hours I've spent playing it this game since release its well worth the initial cost. No IAPs are a huge bonus.   Since it's been released the devs have been actively adding extra content for no additional cost, that's pretty amazing and quite rare in the mobile gaming market if you ask me.

replyContent: Hi! In the star map section there is a smaller map to the right, right above the jump button. That map allows you to select where in a sector to jump into, you can click on the squares there to select your jump point when coming in. You can see how enemy ships are positioned using that map as well. So target the loners and take them out quick.

You play as a starship captain leading a small squadron of ships in a quest to basically wipe out aliens for their transgressions against humans. The background is minimal and more of an excuse to let you do what you came to do: blow stuff aliens and steal their stuff so you can do it better next time. As you play, you can unlock more and better ships with the primary distinction being whether you can field fighters or more guns. Though not without flaws, it's fun.
Nice little time waster,  though progression is slow and no cloud saves.

content: Fantastic game that keeps you coming back. Totally worth every penny
Easily worth $.99, love the dev. Support these guys! Wish it supported higher resolution displays though, looks kinda tinny on the Nexus 6P.

content: I have been playing this game for many months now and I always seem to come back to it. It just updated so I am glad the devs are still interested even though I am sure they're new game is taking priority. Can't wait to see what's new.
Fun rouge like game exploring space and blow ships up.  A bit samey, but a great way to kill 15 min.
Just one of the greatest games

I love this game! And now you guys add cloud save, yusssss thank you! Edit: Lastest update (usable alien ships) is Noice. I have only 2 requests: Pleaseeee let us command bigger fleets and bigger ships. I love seeing big battles unfold.
Keeps getting better, love this last update!

I love this game. If you're like me and you like space ships and space battles, then this game is worth a try. Tons of cool ships and weapons and awesome battles. HOWEVER, I do feel like the punishment for dying is too severe unless I'm missing something. If your capital ship dies, you lose and have to start over. I feel like I would put in hours to build my fleet, customize my weapons, then it all goes to waste when I jump into a sector that has three enemy capital ship. This has turned me away for now...

Now that I've unlocked everything in the game it's just going through the paces now. I'm hoping to see another content update. Perhaps a ship creator so we can modify and build our own ships with our own slots. (Six slot fighter bays and 1 heavy weapon here I come). But it's still a good game.

If you don't mind paying a couple quid for the game it's fantastic! Very star trek dominion wars esque, fantastic little app, hours of fun. Still struggling on how I'm supposed to unlock higher level ships though!
Too bad cloud save requires an account rather than Google cloud save. Also, no Family Share because the Dev hasn't made it retroactive. Bummer.
Cutie
Title says it all... Worth the money
Exactly the space strategy sim I have been searching for. :))
It really got boring for me you just increase in better ships but drones and number of reinforcements, weapons, it all just kinds stays the same and it loses the excitement of the initial play.
replyContent: Thanks! It is really hard to make a game that stays fresh forever, but we try :) Update coming soon, some alien ships to play with.

content: Spotted the developers of this game berating the "player base" for whinning too much about the cost of the game.  But, after purchasing the game on sale, I failed to see any merit to either the uniqueness or any improvement on the norm.  The graphics are nice, but the execution of the game play is clunky and uninspired.  Certainly not worth the price of admission.  The developers need to pay attention to what the user base is saying rather than whine that players are spoiled and don't want to pay for games.
replyContent:
Hello! Thanks for the feedback. We wrote about premium games not getting enough love due to many players feeling that every game should be free. It was not about our game costing too much, more about how an upfront cost on a game makes it hard to sell these days. 

Anyway, you are right about developers listening to players. Thanks again!

content: Best mobile space game I have ever played
One of the best strategy games I've ever played on Android

It really feels like every penny I spent on it went into polishing the finished product. Simple, well-balanced, nice ambience, good customizability and great replayability, like games of olden days. Just a suggestion: it'll be nice if there's an option to play on portrait orientation.

A great space strategy game that leaves you wishing you could micromanage your fleet more. But you can't. I'd like to see a few mechanics from First Contact and Battlestation Classic in this one. That would give it 5 stars.
It's great!

Restart. Look at map. Have to go through a nebula, blackhole, and 2 asteroids to get to anything (and back through them to repair). Restart. Look at map. Have to get through 2 nebula, an asteroid, and a black hole to get to anything. Restart. Randomly assigned 500 less ore and half as much upgrade points as usual. Restart.
Very difficult at first remains challenging throughout

There needs to be more variation in the ships, so that you have more reason to choose different ones. Also, it would be great if certain types of weapons were significantly more or less effective against certain enemies, forcing you to change your equipment frequently.
Please allow us to be able to buy mega plasma and death rays from space stations in the next update, or at least, make them default weapons for alien ships

Great game and well worth the couple of quid to purchase. Nice learning curve, use of strategy, ship build and customisation etc. Completed after god knows how many attempts and hours and will still probably play again.
Tons of replayability also.  I love it.
Annoying pop-up to rate game. Good game but instant 1 star for annoying practices
replyContent:
Hello! Sorry about the inconvenience. We ask this once so more players would remember to rate, it helps us make more games! We let players decide what they want to give.

We feel your review is a bit unfair because otherwise game is completely without in-apps and without intrusive ads. But of course you have the right to your opinion! Best wishes.

content: Great and nice game..worth to pay for it..but many things can be improve..1)game should be longer than 4 maps @ developer can add expansion. 2)game can be saved and shouldn't start back at 0 if you died. 3)please add story to the game.no need animation just picture is good enough.game become more interesting if you add story.
Really enjoy this game but halfway or just at the end of a battle it freezes! Very frustrating but good enough to not make me abandon just yet. Please fix, five star game otherwise!

Its OK but I would like to have more control over ship orders. Like in battle station target shields, largest ships, closest ships etc. It actually feels quite limited in actions you can perform after battle station.  But its still a good game worth getting.

After playing Battlestation First Contact I already anticipated Harbinger to be a very good game. Worth paying for. Unlike Battlestation, this game can go on for hours. Thank you for creating Harbinger ‚ò∫
Lots of fun
Challenging, Fun, and Addictive gameplay. Ships could stand to be a bit cheaper, but it isn't a big issue. The game is worth the $2.
Title says it all. Does get repetitive, but not for a while.

This game is awsome I just got it it is very adittive

Fun

replyContent:
Hello! We only advertise our own new and old games. And there is a button the player has to press in order to see anything. It is like a news section in the game behind a button.

These are small things that helps us make more games in the future. Hopefully you can forgive us :) Best wishes.

Great game one of the best on the market!

This game needs to be updated for a while it's fun but then after awhile it gets boring please more aliens or more ships or something

great game had a good 20 hours on it once i finished the campaign i restart so i could get more ships the more u die the more ships u unlock wich is alright i guess its very fun once u have a good loadout the guns they give u are there for a reason u need to find out where to brake there armour then kill them with guns that can kill the hull this game reminds me of gun of icarus just more of a 2D galaxy star game also the story gives it a good kick gj devs soild 4 star! gameplay 7.8/10

replyContent: Hi! You can turn them off if you google "Turn off notifications android". Go to application settings and find the application there.

content: There are loads of things I love about this game. The graphics and sound effects are lovely. The process of shipbuilding and game physics are really well executed. Now for the bad parts. The "structure" of the game is not great. It would lend itself to some kind of narrative campaign (think Age of Empires), with a smaller skirmish map as an option. The ending (after 4 maps) was really disappointing. Missing features: an index of the characteristics of all ships/weapons in the game; a save option.
Awesome game great difficulty and lots of customisation and strategy really hope they continue to update content as would be more than willing to pay for it :)
I would love to see another update for the game it's simply amazing just maybe like increased forces or bigger ships or something idk I love the replay value on it.

I like the replay value, and it just got better, The update has added so much and I'm really loving the different races and illustrations. If you love mobile games, you'll love this.New updates are awesome
Dark souls of space game :)
This game will save on the long road trips.

Ok, so I'm still playing it but hey, the BSE Harbinger is what Im lookong for a flag ship! üòÉ Its so nice to find a ship with four hangar after all xD. Given the mercenery will stay with you after you finish the galaxy, you can use them throughout the game if they did not get killed!   Dev! Accept my request: Add more ship slots im exchnge for scraps amd upgrade points! xD that would make the battle more fun given that there would be a scene where it looks like a whole armada vs another battalion of enemy ships and station xD
As the subject says... this game rocks
Wish it saved automatically but that's my fault I suppose. Also please enable the option to stop zooming in on objectives for phones... Its stupid annoying.

Wonderful time waster. Thanks for the cloud backup option. I broke my phone last week, am reinstalling now. Now, I know I won't have my complete ship collection because I backed up once, maybe twice. replyContent: Hi! Maybe you have already tried this, but if you place your friendly ship in front of your flagship in formation they will take the damage first. Additionally, you can buy an escape pod facility for your flagship in a red slot. When your flagship is destroyed you can then fly with that to another ship you have. These tactics will help :)

replyContent: Update: Hi! The save game itself cannot be uploaded but the level progress should work. So you can upload the current level you are and not have to unlock ships again on another device.

content: Good game

Reply: Two advanced degrees in quantitative subjects and a university professor here. The only reflection I offer is a grade of F or D for all three so-called tutorials. You apologize for being harsh after implying the customer is an idiot. I offer no apology for an honest review. (Google, please crack down on a lot of obviously fake reviews.) replyContent:
No fake reviews here, look at the review history of the reviewers and it is easy to see they are legitimate.

Sorry you are having trouble, did you play all three tutorial missions? Sorry to be so harsh but over 10 000 know how to play yet you don't, something to reflect about.

content: It's a good game but I find it hard to do much in the game even on easy. Can get so far but always end up out matched by the computer which really ruins the experience. Not saying make it too easy but reduce the difficulty a bit or something.
replyContent: Hi! Are you using the star map scanner screen to choose jump in location? And remember to use battlestations to your advantage, stay close to them and jump out of fights you are about to lose. If enemy follows they will be greeted by a battlestation.

content: It is really good and nice but I have 2 things to say about it: first off I would give it a five if you could have more that just three and for these mercs or officers for hire they shouldn't coat so much and same with the weapons. Secondly you need more stuff to the bases like a recruitment place for adding to your army (you have a good ally recruitment thing thou).

I love this game.  Seriously it's great if you ever played space ship battle games a la FTL or Sins of a solar empire. Lots of new content added for free.  I do wish there was a better selection of gunships to be added to your fleet as carrier spam seems to be the optimal endgame.
Check points would be nice.
Was daunted by the idea of a RTS on mobile but this works great! Very fun and accessible game
5 star due to added content, game is perfect :-)
It's as if FTL and S.P.A.Z. had a special needs child.  In a good way.
Quite fun. Still figuring how everything works.

What a great game!  A true saviour in the landfill of the mobile market.  I didn't know how well this kind of game would play on a phone, but by far it's one of the smoothest.  They say it's like FTL, but I'd compare it more to a game called S.P.A.Z.  Can't wait for the update.  It's already practically perfect for a mobile.  I know this is going to soak up hours of my time and then many more.
Great game for FTL fans
Really enjoying this game. Got some good rouge like space exploration elements, which definitely keep me coming back for me.

The game could however vastly improve by giving a lot more variation of hardware let you own a station and research, built stuff and so on, just so much potential. Not moved to buy desktop version yet, but if the actual gameplay save can sync I will buy again to support further development.

Definitely a five star recommendation. The game allows a great deal of customization and strategy, while remaining simple and quick to play. A great game for tablets while still being very playable on pretty much any PC in existence.
Best game on android

A very good space strategy game.
Great game
A great game with a lot of replay value. Plenty of ways to win but challenges you enough to not make it easy.

Buy ship turrets, upgrade turrets. Sounds easy enough      until you run into a larger ship swarming with fighters. But it's still so satisfying watching my own ship go kabllooie. Only reason it lacks a star is there's no option to have my ship dog fight (chase) the ai. Still an awesome game
Great game love the fact it isnt a super easy game like most
Great Game

I regretfully stayed up until 2 am playing this awesome game! It can be frustrating at first but once you find a good weapon combo that works for you it's very strategic. Around lvl 5 you start unlocking all the good ships. So much fun!

Edit: since i backed this game it hasnt changed a tiny bit , rockets still ruining the game , gameplay is still "jump into sector, afk , if succeed-> jump to another, if not ->run away, repair ,repeat" , you could copy FTL - make ship completely unmovable, game wont change a tiny bit anyway...Game still have no features of original Battlestation :/
replyContent: An content update is coming! We are making the game for Steam and will add more content at the same time. Hopefully publish in November. Please subscribe at http://battlestation.fi to know first hand and be part of the process!

content: Good time waster.

Like its predecessors (battle station, battle station classic) this game super-seeds all of my standards, and BUILDS upon FTL with its own UNIQUE gameplay. Anyway to the real review, this game is hands down amazing, easily understandable GUI, gameplay, storage mechanics, and most importantly, the purchase mechanics, are well thought out. Now As far as gameplay goes, think of the movement of your fighter ships, but this time, you are given COMMAND of the ship, this ship can basically have a fleet maximum of 3 ships each carrying their own different weapon/drone bay slots (based on the ship you buy). Now given this, alot of things are available with out research (something i miss is the researching function) but... as it stands this game is great already. Now that its been updated with expansion thats on PC its in my opinion pretty much complete (i do hope for more drone additions and flagships though), Anyway all in all you cant go wrong getting this game. Extremely fun time killer, and the score boards are fairly fair (although i think they should be reset given highest scores are from initially when the game was first released making reaching those scores close to impossible)
replyContent: Thank you so much for the awesome review commander! It's truly humbling to read and it warms out hearts. We will look into all issues you report so do not worry, we are on it! Got get em' commander.

content: Superb

Very engaging even after dozens of hours of game time. Challenging, but with enough luck, and the right strategy, a person could play indefinitely. I would still like to see upgrades (or unlocks) to the ships themselves become available (a leveling system like C.o.D. maybe?)and other playable races. 4+/5

I'll start with this, I love this game. When it was simpler I enjoyed the heck out of it and I was very, very excited about the new editions. BUT the NEED to fix the atrocious mission system. I can't even ay the game anymore because it is impossible to figure out what I am supposed to do or what step I'm at in these missions as I get so many! They need to put text descriptions on what you need to do next. They also need to fix the target sector moving to the top of the screen when you click it! Please fix
replyContent: Hi! You can tap on each mission in the missions screen (Click missions in star map screen). When you tap on a mission it will move between the sectors you need to visit. The map camera will center on each of the green objective sectors. That green sector is then related to the mission you have selected.

content: Instantly fell in love with this game. Definitively one of the best mobile games I've ever played.

Really enjoying this game, needs a little bit more substance to the story though. Would be nice if game didn't end just because you lost one ship in your fleet.  *****Edit***** I am sorry for the poor review after only playing the game a short time. I now understand why the game works the way it does. This is an excellent game. I recently emailed the developer for technical support and they responded very quickly and solved my problem. Great job devs!
replyContent: Hi! Thank you for the feedback. The game only ends if your flagship dies, the one you start with. You can also build an escape pod in a red slot, which will let you transfer command to another ship should your flagship get destroyed. Glad you enjoy the game!

its only 3 bux or whatever and its got a deep tech tree. no in app purchase bullshit. tons of rts lil niffty things i love. if you like ftl youll like it
*****awesome*****

Previous versions allowed me to level up and gain access to new ships faster, eg after each playthrough. Now a long (albeit failed) play through where i got to the last area only gained me half a level, so no new ships. The game isn't engaging enough for me to put that much in for no reward.
Addictive & Challenging , Definitely Worth The Money . ouch the cloud save is here .. I lost my save way back because of bricked phone.. :( ..

Good game but very short,cleared it on normal 3 hours game play, hope theres more game play in the works and new weapons.

I was such a big fan of the Battlestation: First Contact game that I did not even blink in buying this game when I heard about this. I was not disappointed, either. Even before the last major update, there were a good variety of ships and weapons to pick and choose from. Now there are even more. This game is hard to put down.  However, one design choice in the game confuses me a little. When arming your ships, you do not have access to the entire human arsenal from the weapons purchasing screen. Some weapons can only be purchased through trade with allies or space stations you find in the game. I can understand only being able to obtain alien versions of weapons through trade or salvage, but as you play as the humans, why would you not have access to these weapons if you had the funds to purchase these expensive and powerful weapons, especially when they are labeled human weapons? It does not ruin the game by any means, but it just seems an inconsistency within the game design.

I have played a lot of games and this is the best game for touch screen that I have played. I'm level 23 in a couple days and it's really cool the ships r somewhat realistic. I can't wait for them to add more ships. A good idea would be a sage like ship or gun that can take hostile bases and ships
Great space roguelike with quite a few options. Needs more weapon and mission variation.

Unlocking ships is the only purpose of replay.However once you unlock the Harbinger ship the ships that follow are complete junk. Kept playing anyway. After last ship was unlocked got bored and uninstalled. Keep it up,
However, I can't put it away...
Totally better than i expected. Love it. Get it.

content: I set this game aside a few weeks ago because I got a little bored of it.  As soon as the update hit I picked it right back up and now it's the go to game on my device.  It's just a superbly put together game, well worth what is paid for it.  A multi-player option would make it the perfect time killer.  I know the developer is a 3 man team but look forward to more content in the future.
It's fun, not buggy, not laggy, has a lot to explore, and doesn't ask me to buy "harbingerCoins" or any other such nonsense. Definitely worth it.  5/5!

Great game would love to see some sort of endless map where all types of ships spawn from all races and possible a multiplayer feature or being able to play as the other races with the ability to buy armour plating or a new module where u can use a commander ability like super shields that don't reduce/bolster shields for x amount of time or magnitude hull so plasma/energy blasts have no effect but missiles do double damage
Good but short
Awesome game, keep this genius coming

This game has blew my mind. Every second I am on this thing. In fact so much that I now normally charge my phone roughly every 4-5 hours. I couldn't have asked for a better game. And now when I look at other games I base them off of this game because of how amazing it is. I must say that you must get the game

Worth the price.  I hesitated buying this since the previous Battlestation games were unbalanced and got tedious quickly. Happily, this is different.   This is a fun, enjoyable space adventure with a lot of replay value.  In fact you'll have to replay it if you want to get anywhere.  You will probably die a few times. While the game ends if you die, you gain experience that carries into the next game.  Eventually you will level up even if you lose a few times.  This means you can experiment with initial weapon loads. There's a wide assortment of apparently random missions and a decent tutorial.    No in app purchases or ads. Great game.  I hope future upgrades will be to THIS game and not another you have to pay again to play.
Not like the other games not in a good way
I love this game so much! Awesome game but I just recommended more music and more little easter eggs that everyone loves.

Great space-exploration themed rogue-like with light RPG elements.  Develop your ship, survive a little longer (then change your strategy again) and scavenge resources to upgrade/trade/hire mercenaries or eventually expand your fleet.  Lots of depth and not afraid to leave some important elements unexplained.   This makes it more challenging, but also more rewarding in the long run.  Be prepared to lose hours at a time to this one.

This game is just what I've been looking for! I love this game! I worry about games that I pay for and I take caution before buying them. But it had a lot of good ratings and now I see for myself that it is awesome. We need more games like this. And no internet needed! Keep up the good work guys! Hats off to you!
Totally addictive:))

Im racing through the missions on each difficulty and now just boredom...really love this game but not as fun...an open world multiplayer of this game on steam i would play everyday and spend good money on it.

content: Hi I was just wandering if you are just a 3 man team why not go and recruit so the game making would be easier and less time consuming and also could you add other playable factions please?
replyContent: Hi! Well it costs to recruit more talented people, and we don't have the money to do that. It's not easy to find people that suit well with the team either. We just try to do the best we can with what we have! Thank you, we are currently planning a whole new game so stay tuned at http://battlestation.fi/forums and register there!

content: Keep up good work
Very nicely made.  Lots of ship options, weapons, and drones.  Best of all, no internet connection required!  It's my go-to time killer.

Did a 5* review a long time ago for a much older version. Since then there have been more ships added, some new weapon types, new enemies, and the implementation of an endless mode! I highly recommend this game to anyone that likes space, spaceship battles and real time strategy. *Caution* You will lose track of time playing this addictive game.

This a full on game. You have to play tactical, or get absolutely crushed. You learn this pretty early on, and after you figure everything out, this game has a near infinite replay ability. I recommend this to anybody. Great developer, has a fantastic business model. I would be willing to pay for game expansions for this.
Favourite app ever.
Easily my favorite outer space rpg
Nice game. Good fun.

The overall feel of the game is well done but it needs more variety. After ten jumps nothing new starts to happen. Come on guys, it's space, the embodiment of the unknown. Fill it with cool stuff to see like Out There or FTL. Combat its excellent but needs balancing on shields and nukes. Especially because nukes aren't that high-tech and they make the most damage.
replyContent: Hi! Thank you for the advice :) We will definitely add more content in the near future. We will also try to balance the game. Keep on rocking commander!

content: I have been playing Harbinger since last fall. I actually deleted it for awhile because of lack of updates and something happened where my save got wiped out and I lost all my levels. Kill all the xenos
Slow paced at first but once you get the train rolling it get pretty intense

If I spend 10 hours getting to a point I shouldn't lose ALL of my progress. Pointless game, don't waste your time or your money unless you prefer monotony.
replyContent: Hi! After the first 3-4 unlocked ships the ships will ramp up in power every time. Also if you have spent 10 hours getting to some point you have played the game a bit wrong, sorry to say :) Remember to jump out of battles you are about to lose. You can do it, Commander!

content: I don't get this game...it looks interesting but I just zone in to an area, get shot to pieces, and lose whenever a big ship is present. replyContent: Hi! Are you jumping out of fights you are about to lose? This game requires some retreating at times, and the optimal way to do it is to be near a Battlestation and jump back to that sector. Sometimes the enemy follows so this works well. Also, remember to use the sector scanner to choose the location in which you warp into.

content: Perfect! absolutely. This is a game that receives regular updates and has real dedication from its Devs! There's so much to do! It's not a simple; select a ship, and then fly around doing a few missions. It's a select a ship ranging from a small carrier to a battleship and then your escorts range from scouts to heavy carriers. Then you need to collect some scrap, and parts to upgrade whatever main weapons systems, shields, or hardpoint defences you want to equip. Or even pick up some stock or partly upgraded ones along the way, trade with other fleets or ships and battlestations.  Something Id love to see (and i know its being done) is more ships. But I'd love to see something like a "shipyard". Something with maybe 3 Hangers for fighters/drones/bombers and possibly a "Frigate Hanger" where you can build Frigates (for example). something that packs a bigger punch than a small attack/defence craft. Maybe you can only have 1 shipyard and support a limited number of frigates that cost scrap to build. maybe just 1 main weapons slot per shipyard that has a large buff to shield generators, repair beams and teleporters, can equip a lot of hardpoints, and have very limited movement.

I have only unlocked ships up to level 4 so far. Great game! Always nice to find a game with a punishing learning curve. I wish I had the ability to customize a ship with my own setup (e.g. allow me 6 slots and let me decide if I will use drones, extra guns or support turrets). Hands down love this game. Keep it up!
This game is lots of fun. Looking forward to the upcoming content update.

Almost love it. There needs to be an easy way to distinguish the status of my own ships vs the enemy, perhaps a highlighter on the "nameplate" or a small bar at the top of the HUD that can be toggled. When we're overlapped and shields and hull are dropping fast, it's a guessing game who is about to die. It's led to more than a few frustrating moments. Also, it would be helpful to be able to see what modules are available to a ship before purchasing. Unless it's by design for some particular reason, I don't know why this would be left out. Lastly, it sadly has to be said but thank you devs for setting a reasonable price instead of going the pay to win/wait to play route more and more are going. I'll happily support your products in the future. Highly recommended.
replyContent: Hi! Thank you for the feedback. Yes the own ship could be separated more. When your flagship is getting really low there are red lines that appear on all sides of the screen. That is one indicator to let you know to jump out, quickly :)

content: Very good (and hard) game in early stage. But still need to improve or add more weapon option.

It used to be a great and, don't get me wrong, is still great game, with a few major issues.   1. Easy is not easy any more (even with highest tier ship and maxed out weapons along with other friendly ships in front of me, I do melt in a few seconds) 2. EMP is too op. Sometimes you'd have multiple EMP on map, forcing you to waste multiple turns. I had to restart the whole game a few times because I just couldn't get out of that certain map due to frequent EMP.  3. Projectile Gun reload function was great, and one of the feature I liked, which is gone now.  4. Escorting ship is pretty much impossible as well.   If you can adjust the difficulty on Easy mode, it'd be better. Oh, and with less EMP. Personally I think up to two turns stuck is ok, Anything more than that I shouldn't be having more EMPs.
replyContent: Hi! Thank you for the feedback. We will try to look over the difficulty and EMP. Projectile cannon: In the first version it was the best turret with recharge rate upgrade, having the highest DPS of all turrets, even better than mega plasmas. Yet it was also the cheapest, we got requests to nerf it and we had to. Did not mean to cause frustration!

replyContent:

content: Fun
