Think Gratuitous Space Battle without the complexity.  Not what I thought it would be.  You equip your ship, then fly from point to point (on a somewhat limited path) and get blown up by hostile ships.  I have yet to do more than 10-12 turns on the easy setting, no matter how I arm my ship.    I was looking for something slightly dumbed down from Star Traders 4x, but now I'm looking for something with more complexity.  There's not much here, no story (just back story for the tasks you're carrying out).  I don't feel very involved.  I'm going to uninstall for now and maybe revisit when they do their big update.  I usually equate app purchases to a cup of coffee house coffee: for the same price, did I get the enjoyment equaling a cup of fancy coffee.  In this rare case, despite the low sale price, I'd have been better off with the macchiato.
replyContent: Hey there! Check out this video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qQzi22x8fEQ In the current version it is best to leverage the Battlestations and use distress beacons to lure enemies into traps. Once you get a fleet going the going gets good! Laser and bolter drones, will give you a good start. And upgrade the max ships on the drones.

content: Wow after installed this game again everything is so much better now. Great job!

However, it needs more scenarios and stories. It also need better AI progression  matching (within same game), better formation support (and better speed delineation between ships/roles), and hard counters (ie. reason for using different weapons) for more 'intellectual' game play. The overbearing 'click here' tutorial should be removed entirely (it was aggravating and useless) and hints should be suppressable. There are also a few bugs, such as using the best locked ship at level 1, which makes earning the ship feel like a waste..
You have to be Damaged to play this game.  Its punishing
Worth it.
Every game plays out different. Different ships need different tactics.
Couldn't expect much more out of a space ex/RPG.
Sometimes hard but really good and addictive. Definitely worth the money.
Reply good
Really fun little space wandering game. Also mega thanks for selling a complete game!

Super fun and difficult! Keep coming back for more in this Sci fi rpg roguelike! Great randomization, and would make an excellent stepping stone for something like the old bbs door game Trade Wars 2002 (hint hint amazing 3 man dev team!)
Awesome game,would be even better if other race is an option.
Hard but good
Running on note 2 the game freezes, mostly with large numbers of fighters on screen and not right away.
Love the updates. Nice job on the last patch to rebalance the hard mode. Its beatable now. Please make it harder. Lol. Jk. Seriously. Good work .

Excellent game. I enjoy the RTS style of the game and the random chance of super weapons being found from wreckage.  Now with the update even more weapons and enemy ships to fight. New missions which makes it less shoot this, defend that.  Cant wait for the new updates in Jan/Feb 2016. bring on more guys. More ships for us to pilot would be great.  Well worth the money
Awesome opossum!

One of the best apps out there, I just made 11k score on hard legit lol!!! I've been playing 3 days straight and finally got the number 1 score xD can't wait for the score board to update :o number 1 wooow!!
Had loads of fun playing this and looking forward to the updates. Can take ages in some games to get enough fire power but that adds to the enjoyment when you start smashing through the enemy fleets.
Every now and then you find a gem on the playstore. FTL like greatness. I commend you bugbyte
Fun game
Love it

Not everything is clear. I could have used more of a tutorial but I'm figuring it out. Ui and graphics are clean and polished. Gameplay is smooth and engaging. Moving ships around in combat isn't always easy but otherwise this is a fantastic game. Really well thought out and put together.
Love it
I want the ARMADA! This game is awesome btw, with the downside of not being able to buy ships or anything with real money :(

Bought the game on a whim and I'm now unable to stop playing. It's very challenging and will frustrate the hell out of you while you learn the various ways of playing and develop your own strategies. There's more depth to the game than I first realised. I can't wait for a Pc version!

This is probably one of the best games on the market for its price if RTS/roguelikey things are in your wheelhouse. Unfortunately for me it stalls and crashes 4-5 times an hour or so on my Galaxy S4. Sometimes the game will hang for 20 seconds, or the sound will crash, and every time I exit the game it crashes the Android OS temporarily. But I know this only because I'm still playing it constantly despite.
replyContent:
Hi! Try turning the sounds off, so no weapon sounds on. You can do that in the main menu of the game. Music can be on.

This is a bit of a rare and specific issue, we are working on it. It is not specific to device models, but to the chipset they use.

content: Barely playable. Glitches often. No explanations for anything.
replyContent: Sorry you felt that way! What kind of glitches? Would help us solve the problems. The game has 3 small tutorials which get you started, but yes the game has a bit of a steep learning curve but once you get the hang of it, it becomes fun! Don't give up, Commander. Recommend this video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qQzi22x8fEQ

content: I've been looking for a game like this for a long time! Love it!!
Great game guys!  Awesome update!  So addictive and fun.  Where has this game been my whole life?
replyContent: Hi! Thank you very much. Manual would be good, no doubt. Right now the best manual is our forums at http://battlestation.fi . Huge update coming soon, before Christmas. Stay tuned and Merry Christmas!

content: The update added a lot of cool new things that made the game more difficult and strategic. My only issue is that it's really difficult starting off, more scrap at the beginning would be nice.
If you are a fan of homeworld, FTL, sins of a solar empire, this is the closest I've  found to it on android. Seriously worth it
This game is hard but it's good fam

Great game!   What it needs: - Battle Music (same theme plays throughout the game, its more like ... Save point music) - More Modules (specifically ones that increase the speed, hull and turn rate of your ship) - Larger player fleet, more enemies, more HP all around: this has the potential to have some pretty epic space battles, if there were more ships, they lasted longer and you could recruit a larger player fleet.
It's one of the best RTS on the play store. Could use a little better tutorial but still getting 5* from me, and it's worth every penny.  Keep up the good work.
I just love it.

Since up date and improvements I would like to see ally vessel fight in sectors and travel to sectors on their own with a well balanced AI. More human vessels for higher levels. It would be awesome to build a fleet of three or a vessel from the space station and order them to a sector and relocate them later if needed. Also would like to see more enemy vessels in one area and more weapons and on the smaller weapons like to see more range. Thanks guys for an awesome game

With the update, the gameplay tuning is the best in the Play Store. Perfect difficulty. Love the AI additions! Story? Like the new bits there and two more races and so much more? If you're reading this then you must buy!!!
Such a great  game.
Great game with fresh updates included in the price. Just revitalised my playing with latest update. Hard at first until you build up, good challenge

its a really nice space rts with rpg elements. worth the buy because of tons of replayability. They also seem to be updating it still, thats always a plus. -Edit- Its also a roguelike, when you die your dead. If you do not like hardcore games they have an easy mode so you should still try anyway.
Look you guys are doing an amazing job but I need new ships like the armada with 4 ship ports
Love it
Five stars for an old version, ten stars for the update.

This used to be my favorite game, but since the new update, I find it to be too difficult even on easy.  You took a great game and complicated it with extra stuff that nobody will use.  On top of that, the enemies are way too numerous and way too hard later on.  And to top it off, the ion storms keep pulsing, and I can't escape.......  Stop adding crap that nobody will use anyway.  It just slows down gameplay and takes up space in my phone.  Thanks
replyContent:
Hi! Sorry you feel that way, we are still tweaking the game. This newest version has more Battlestations on the easy difficulty in galaxies, and doubled starting scrap metal for normal. 

All the added features was asked for by the community, we took the most asked features from our forums and implemented those.

Did not mean to cause frustration!

content: A nice, solid game, more fun once I figured up upgrades and shifting inventory, one thing the tutorial didn't really cover well.  The most recent updates really improved game play replayability.   Tough rogue like, requires thoughtful strategy. Even playing with the best ships, Hard can sometimes pull checkmates.

Utterly compelling, decent longevity and the latest update is like a whole new expansion pack. The plot is rendered endearingly in second-language English and there are still bugs to be squished but this stomps all over any Free To Play junk out there.
No way out of the battle, if you visited the wrong place, game over.
replyContent: You can use the star map button in midst of battles to jump out of battles. It has to be recharged though. Use the scanner section in star map to choose the location you jump into within a sector, you can jump further away from the enemies and scope out how the fight is going to go. The FTL button will have more time to recharge that way.

content: This game is excellent! The only suggestion I might make would be an endless mode, with enemies getting progressively harder or more numerous but even without that, I love this! *UPDATE* Please don't make the game easier! Part of what kept me coming back was how you could have upgraded everything and still get wiped out for overconfidence! I'll drop a hint for others finding it difficult: drones, gatlings and missiles will see you through!
Do yourself a favor and buy this awesome game
Hint: Use teleport upgrade to move ship across sector faster. Most challenging and addictive game yet. Great job guys.
Good game

replyContent: Hi! If you hit play and an error message comes up, (Crash message) then it is best to clear data of the game. Got to your device settings - applications - Battlestation: Harbinger and click on clear data. Here is how to do it: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3B2EPFqyzS4

content: Good game.
replyContent: Hi! Are you experiencing any freezing issues with your phone? Is the game running good?

content: This is exactly the kind of game I've always wanted for mobile. Thank you for making this.

replyContent: Hi! You can always jump out of fights, if the star map button has recharged. Use that and jump back to the Battlestation, repair your ship there and head back out. We are going to make the "easy" difficulty easier, update coming this week.

content: Well supported with updates too
This is a good little rts, the updates have added good stuff and definitely my favourite android game.  Works good on my 5" phone screen but amazing on a tablet.

Prequel update to the January/February one has been amazing. Love the new content and look forward to the rest. Definitely not a 4x game but rogelike space rts.  It would be nice if resources were a little more plentiful on easy as it's far from easy unless you use a fleet of drones. Dev said they were balancing in the big update so let's hope that changes things. Amazingly fun however, and not overly micromanaging.  Different scenarios keep it interesting. Worth purchasing. Thank you! Keep up the good work
Easy to pick up and no annoying ads

To those who find the new update difficult, it gets really easy when you get the Death Ray. It's like the nuke, except that it is faster, range is longer, more accurate and point defence is useless against it.
Downloaded new update and after a few play throughs I logged on and everything was reset. Please fix, I don't want to grind out 12 ships on a harder difficulty.
replyContent: Very unfortunate! We don't know what happened there in your case, bad luck :( It is impossible to fix but there is a way you can get experience fast. Play the game on "hard" difficulty and just die right away, you will get a lot of xp. Keep doing this until you have some better ships again! You can contact support@bugbyte.fi . Please don't rate bad

content: Best space game! Hard but addicted

Love the new contents, thanks for the updates. Not a fan of the new map. Should be all visible again for preplanning of routes. It's enough not to know enemy movements in the vicinity but starmaps should logically be available. Destroyed ships could also drop intelligence on nearby systems. Truth is, the game now is much harder on easy. Could discourage new players
Great fun
Takes a little getting used to, but I think I'm gettin the hang of it.
Why i cannot upgrade reload speed?
replyContent:
The projectile cannon and Energy cannon recharge time upgrades were broken. They were overpowered and made the turrets the most powerful in the game, yet they were also the cheapest. 

There are still recharge time upgrades on other turrets. Energy and Projectile cannon still have burst, which is much the same thing. But in short, they were too op.

content: Great update and more to come
I can play this game for hours.  It's also pretty easy on battery.  Keep up the great work.

Build your armada of space ships, wile equipping them with your desired weapons.  Then wash over your enemy, to earn more advanced ships to strengthen your fleet. Great UI, music/sound effects, and graphics. Thank you for the update. Every thing works great on my jxd s7800b and motoG
This game sucks... all of my free time! It should come with a health warning, as I often end up painfully hobbling from the bathroom on rubber-like legs with pins & needles.
Amazing game

From being a good game before the update. It's become a fantastic game. The developers are doing a great job and showing that they have big plans for this game. Great work.
One of those rare games where you get exactly what you imagined and then some. The new update is incredible!
Lot more balanced and the memory bugs seem to be sorted
replyContent: Hi! We will have to focus on fixing all the bugs and issues first some people are experiencing. After that we can focus on more content. Thank you for your patience! Also the galaxies are always randomized, giving an unlimited amount of galaxies to play. But we will also add more content in the near future.

content: This game is good fun. I definitely prefer it with the new update too. Just more options and complexity would make it even better.

It's a pretty good game I definitely think this one was worth the purchase.

Awesome!

Also on some of the ships, the smaller spots for things like lasers or bolters, they look like they are positioned in the front of the ship when actually they are on the side and won't shoot anything in the front. Otherwise, I love this game so much.

content: Build your ship, kill enemy ships, get scrap, upgrade your ship, repeat. The ships move pretty slowly so you need to plan your moves and have the right weapons combo. The game isn't easy,  even with the difficulty set to  "easy". Five thumbs up.

Hi! Sorry to hear about your stat loss. Unfortunately there is no fix. You can, however, play the game on hard difficulty and just die right away. That will give you experience quite quickly.

Change ship direction, launch/call back fighters and set one priority target.
Fun

content: Massively entertaining.  Even with the playthroughs being similar, they're never wholly the same.  It's easy to shake things up by trying different fleet combos.

Something gratifying about rolling into a zone with an armada at my command and just blowing the hell out of the unsuspecting enemy. I love what you've done with this game and is probably the most fun I have had with an app in quite some time. Very refreshing and love that this isn't in the F2P model. I wish more devs would follow your model and deliver paid games with this kind of depth. Keep up the awesome work and I'm very much looking forward to your new additions in Jan/Feb! O and the $1.99 price point right now is a steal!
Very good strategy game. No ads and good upgrades.
Love it, plays similar to FTL but the combat is in real time and there's no crew to manage!

On a basic level the game is easy enough to understand and great for a quick 5 minute blast around the galaxy but I've very quickly found myself losing an hour or two at a time to it and I'm still only on the 'easy' galaxy.  Brilliant! :D
Time killer

I'll probably keep playing it, but several times on easy after leveling up for a couple hours, I'd go into a sector and there'd be 15 big ships, which was inescapable death.  That's probably not balanced well.
Rediculous addictive.
Just what I was looking for. Some repition and replaybility.

Its an awesome game and i would say its even better than ftl. You could give it a little more content like oxigen and it would be awesome of you could choose your own cre and stuff like naming your ships to make the game a little more personal :D

Although I think it were some greedy developers who started the whole free to play model, I absolutely agree with you in all the other thoughts. I really hate the f2p model and find those games unpleyable. While I certainly don't wish to pay 40 bucks for a mobile game, I constantly search for premium games on google play, where I pay once and get a full game. A latte's price is really not much for a good mobile game. Also, premium games are really much more serius and complete games. My point is that I support your team, don't give up. I still suck at Harbinger but I really enjoy the game and I keep playing. I'd like a fast forward button for the battles - just an idea. I can't wait for the promised new content, I'm so curious. content: Very Adictive ;) fun game
Very addictive

Fun game that both frustrates and challenges you. Story missions are the same on all difficulties, would be nice to have different stories, even if it's just a change of text. content: Awesome

Fun space themes and good game mechanics compete with remarkably bad weapon design. There are dozens of weapons but literally all of them are worse that the two cheapest default guns, and by a very wide margin. Its possible the programmers don't understand how math works, as many of the "upgrades" available are significant downgrades to dps, accuracy, etc... that or the developers are just trolling. It was very disappointing to find rare/unique weapons only to trash them after seeing how useless they were.
replyContent: Hi! Yes the turrets are a bit off with parameters, we are working on re-balancing the game for an Extended Edition of the game. You can check it out on Kickstarter by searching for Battlestation Harbinger. A lot of new stuff and better balance is coming!

content: I hate phone games but this one is awesome. Easily worth it.
Awesome

Great game. Stop thinking about it and get it! High replayability - I want all them ships!! Ship balance for Gunboat styles (destroyers and cruisers) could do with some work - would like them to be faster so you can make the most of different weapon types for the ships with more weapon hardpoints and higher shield/hull. This isn't a downer though. Still get it.

It's a rogue like and it's hard. You will definitely get ganked a lot. However spend some time with it and you will see it's depth. There are some high end things going on under the hood and it's hard core space opera and rts combined. The almost super Nintendo Era aesthetic is well done and there are a ton of upgrades. No in app Purchases and the developer is committed to hq games that you can buy outright. Amazing game.
replyContent: Hi! Thanks for the feedback. Check this video out: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=X_fQu8xNq0A It might give you some tips.

content: Very strategic and addictive game.

(UPDATED: Thanks to dev's reply. Now I know that repair drone needs scrap metal to repair my ships. I'm giving back 1 star. Rating is now 4 stars). This is a great game, but repair drones tend to glitch out and not repair my ships. This is the worst. I spent so much resources to buy and upgrade them. They suddenly stopped repairing. They just hover near my ship and do nothing. Also, my saved progress isn't transferred across devices.
replyContent: Hi! Repair drones need scrap metal to repair. If your scrap metal is 0 the drones cannot repair. Maybe this is the issue? Let us know! Yes and true, the game doesn't have cloud save.

content: This game is downright awesome. I could not stop playing once I started. No in app purchases is a win to me. Keep up the good work devs.

content: This game is frustrating. The developers have obviously put in a lot of effort into making the foundations of a great game, however there is almost no substance to it right now - the campaign consists of only 3 maps! There is a handful of weapons but most are useless. The only point in replaying is to get a better ship (most of which are also pointless) and the only way to do this is by starting and dying immediately... My recommendation to anyone is to wait for some content before buying.

replyContent: Hi! You can level up faster by playing hard and just dieing in right away in the beginning. We changed the level up system because we got complaints that the level up was too fast.

content: Epic find. Game is everything i have ever wanted from a mobile game. Shall be backing and downloading on pc. Thankyou muchly for making and await eagerly for more content. :)
OK, but repetitive

I had to change my review from 5 to 2 because it won't save my progress. I bought this last night and play a bunch and got to level 2. Now whenever I play, get any progress then shut off the app or turn off phone all that time is reset to level 2. This needs to get fixed as it completely breaks the progression system and the game. Please help with this and not the cookie cutter response I've seen this company post since the kickstarter started. Edit: thanks was getting frustrated and irritable. Will try it
replyContent: Hi! That is unfortunate. Here is a couple of things you can try: 1. Play the game on hard and die instantly, do this enough times to level up and then exit the game. Try coming back to see if your exp sticks. 2. If 1 doesn't work go to your application settings on your device and clear data. Play hard and die a couple of times, you will lvl up.

content: This game is really unbalanced. You can unlock ships but the starter ship will, at least until the 4th ship, be the strongest. Haven't unlocked after that but I doubt they'll be better. Armament of your ships is severely limited. You can only have three ships even though you will swim in money at the end of every game. The game is fun-ish but it's lack of expansion and variety is a real limitation.
replyContent: Greetings commander! We want to give a friendly announcement that we are working on a big content update for Harbinger! Please join the discussion here and register to help us make it: http://battlestation.fi/forums/topic/battlestation-harbinger-content-update-kickstarter/

content: Guys, you got something going here. Solid concept, nice controls. The story base is there, I hope you plan to build on that. Some issues and ideas: often the destroy ship mission has no target, as if I blew up the ship before I found the mission, so it cannot be completed. Weapons need balancing: lasers are way too weak, nukes and plasma cannons from stations are too expensive (same or better effect with stock plasma and missiles). Would be cool if alien weapons were available in some shop.

replyContent: Hi! If you are having trouble understanding the game you can watch this let's play: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=X_fQu8xNq0A It should clear things up! All the best, commander. UPDATE: You get experience every time you play. In the end score screen you will see your commander level. With each new level you reach you will unlock a new ship.

content: Very impressed with Harbinger! Picked it up after playing first contact. Good story, though slightly lacking depth. Decent missions spanning across three randomly generated maps with different enemies. Missions could benefit from a few more options like (destroy an enemy research ship full of research points or destroy a scrap facility at sector). Space combat in this game is incredibly fun and painful at the same time! Strategy is required and planning your next move is a must! Can't wait for more!!

content: It's a cool game but without a save option, I don't know, I get to the end of the first map after upgrading all the ships, die, then start it all again from the beginning. Seems unbalanced and random.
replyContent: Hi! This game belongs to the Roguelite genre, and as such permadeath is part of the game. We have complemented this with randomly generated galaxies, so in that sense every new game is really new! We will, however, take your request into consideration. Thanks!

content: You will lose, a lot, after much hard work getting your ship as powerful as possible. But you can't save, so that effort is mostly lost. The frustration is almost the same as FTL, but like FTL the consolation is that you unlock new craft the further you make it before being mercilessly annihilated. I don't like losing a game so easily and suddenly but it's still addictive

content: Graphics: like an old flash game. Story: barely existent. Gameplay: average at best. Remarks: Stable, bug free. Very limited tactical value, even less strategy. Leveling is too slow. Unlocked ships too useless. You start again when you die. Interface too hard to figure out (only vague icons,  no text). Getting rushed by 15 Capitol ships at once when you only have 1 ship is just frustrating.

content: Are you going to expand the campaign in the future? Three phases is way too short for this price point. Game isn't bad. Story is thin. But length is the real letdown. Also, recently had to reset my phone. Past progress does NOT transfer via Google Play Games and dev has made the level up system so sloooow in a recent update. I'd have to play 6x more to get back up to unlocking the Armada. Literally, might have to beat the game a half dozen to a dozen times. Probably more. No thanks.
replyContent: Yes we will definitely expand the game in the future. Did you already beat the game on hard commander? The game also has an unlimited amount of randomly created galaxies, but more is to come.

content: Play time so far has been a few hours on normal mode. This game is not your typical easy mobile game you need to put serious thought into how you equip your ship. content: The carrier you start with is better than any ship you unlock past that? Intill the next carrier on level 7-8. You need more content. Like more than 5 slots for wepons. Drones Or shield. replyContent: They are different ships commander, some have hangars some don't. The ones without hangars are more durable and usually have better shields. You can have 3 ships, and the bigger ships have 8-10 weapon slots. Combined they make upwards 25 weapon slots. Currently the game has 2 friendly units, Battlestations and Civilian ships to escort.

content: Really enjoy the game. Fantastic replayability. Tough as nails, still havent beaten an entire playthrough and i love it that way. Looking forward to some new content. It's the kind of game that makes my head swim with the possibilities of what it already is and what it could become. Developers prepare yourself for a long and thourough email full of simple to iplement ideas that would really add some pop. Both battlestation games are great can't wait for more. P.s. you should gift the game to some let's players like Mathas who could get you some exposure. The game deserves it.

content: The game is really fun the space battles never get old, but there are a few mechanics I hope get some attention. The first is movement. content: PIRATES, BUY THIS GAME TO SUPPORT THE DEVELOPERS!  This game has the best top-down space combat I've played on mobile, and I've played a lot of them. You can customize your ships with different modules (weapons, shields, scanners, etc) and where you place them is important, as certain weapons may only fire on ships that are on a certain side. Because of this, positioning is very crucial.

Battle station harbringer is a game where you play as the leader of 1 to 3 ships(not including fighters). There are tons of ships that can be played as including assualt ships, carriers, capital ships, and more. There are no microtransactions in this game once you pay you own the whole thing. In conclusion this is a very fun well made game.

content: Best Android game I have played so far, does have a dose of RNG to keep things interesting, which may frustrate some but I find it fun most the time. I think this game is just a good game in general and not just a good game on Android, if that makes sense. I'll pick it up on pc as well.    Check out the forums for tips, one thing that wasn't obvious to me, was that this game has loot. Occasionally after killing, you'll see boxes on the area map that didn't get absorbed by you. That is your loot. Go to your inventory screen and it's in the red section, you'll either need to equip it or drag it to your storage (green section), which you can also sell later if you don't need it.

content: Please explain. Alot of game devs seem to be abusing this and other perms lately. I hope you guys aren't doing the same. What's more shocking is that most people don't care
replyContent:
Hello!

We use this permission to track installs only, the device id enables us to separate unique installs. All the data we gather is anonymous, we do not gather any personal information. It is just to gather some data and gather up statistics of our apps. Hope this answers your question!

content: Absolutely love this game! Only problem I see is thier is no save option that I can find!

content: Really good, looks great, plays smoothly. Love it. The update has fixed the system arrival crash and following your advice, I have found the basic fighter controls. Would still be nice to specify stance: defensive/aggressive and target type: smallest/biggest/nearest etc. But still, great game, you guys are awesome.
replyContent: Hello! We will look into the issue right away. You can control the fighters by clicking on an enemy bigger ship and choosing which squadron should attack. If you click on your own ship it will have a button to call them back. This if you have any kind of hangar! UPDATE: We have fixed the bug! A new update should be live in the store in 4 hours!
